intro: Forsteronia monteverdensis, commonly known as the Monteverde forsteria, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Costa Rica. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, showy white or pale blue flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a slight pubescence. Forsteronia monteverdensis thrives in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to the unique microclimate of its high-altitude habitat.
